results.title: Nature of matter: an atomic view
results.creator_credit: Steven Katten and C R M Production
results.brief_description: Visits Dr Erwin Meuller Laboratory Pennsylvania State University to demonstrate the field-ion microscope. Discusses wave particle duality and spectroscopy. Photographed by Isidore Mankofsky with music composed by Fred Karlin.

results.title: Erosion and weathering: looking at the land
results.brief_description: Explains the basic principles of weathering and erosion and describes the vital functions that both perform in modifying the earth’s surface.

results.title: Palio
results.creator_credit: Michael Weigall and Michael Weigall Productions
results.brief_description: Shows “The Palio”, a wild horse race representing Siena’s seventeen districts. Held in a mediaeval square, it was inaugurated in the 18th century by Violanta of Medici as a safety valve for local factions continuing to this day, and is dubbed as the world’s only political horse race.

results.title: Tale of Three Cities
results.creator_credit: Pierre Desbonnet, Gilbert Lauzun and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Visits three cities from three continents in three different stages of development. Shows the problems of growth and how, if they can, plan for the future. Cities studied are: Djakarta (Indonesia), Caracas (Venezuela) and Stockholm (Sweden).
Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Whales: Can they be saved?
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Post, Alan P. Sloan and Reid-Cowan Productions
results.brief_description: Shows a variety of species within the two major branches of the whale family: the baleen and the toothed whales. Describes their characteristics and behaviour. Because modern whaling is so efficient many whales are in danger of extinction.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kenneth Post, Alan P. Sloan and Reid-Cowan Productions

results.title: The Cactus: adaptations for survival
results.brief_description: This film explains how the cactus has been able to adapt successfully to harsh environments through its unique physical characteristics and lifecycle. Demonstrates its water-conserving characteristics. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Bionics: man or machine
results.creator_credit: Alan P. Sloan and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents a brief history of bionics, the science of copying nature. Examines some of the successful machines that have been created as a result of bionic research, and investigates some possibilities for the future. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Woman is
results.brief_description: Uses a series of photographic stills in order to illustrate the history and character of the roles that women occupy in society. Stresses the contrast and individuality of the people within each role. The film is composed of approximately four hundred separate images of women collected from drawings, paintings and photographs. Music and sound effects compliment the quotes and comments about the situation of women throughout history.
